articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: MATT O’RILEY swept in his sixteenth goal of the season in Celtic’s crucial 2-1 win over their Ibrox rivals at Parkhead yesterday. But the champions’ midfield maestro squandered the opportunity to add to his tally when he fluffed a penalty-kick early in the second-half which would have restored his team’s two-goal advantage. O’Riley didn’t attempt to [...]
articles.title: WHAT O’RILEY REALLY THOUGHT ABOUT HIS MISSED PENALTY-KICK

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: CAPTAIN MARVEL Callum McGregor hailed the true grit spirit of Celtic as the champions put one hand on this season’s Premiership title. The Scotland international anchorman was back to his reliable best in his midfield beat as the Hoops saw off their Ibrox foes 2-1 with an opener from Matt O’Riley and an own goal from [...]
articles.title: ‘JOB ISN’T FINISHED YET,’ WARNS McGREGOR

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS has emerged victorious on THIRTEEN occasions in his 17 derby duels. The Celtic manager has also seen his side held on three occasions while suffering a solitary reverse. Rodgers celebrated again after the Hoops’ 2-1 victory over Philippe Clement’s Ibrox side yesterday nudged the champions towards their third successive title triumph. Reflecting on his latest success, [...]
articles.title: RODGERS 13 v RANGERS 1

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS fired back at his critics as Celtic prepared a third successive Premiership title party at Parkhead on Saturday. The champions swept to within one point of making absolutely certain of their twelfth championship in 13 years after dismissing Philippe Clement’s Ibrox side 2-1 in the east end of Glasgow yesterday. articles.description: CELTIC 2 RANGERS 1   ALL THAT was missing was the Premiership title presentation. This pulsating, pulverising occasion at Parkhead had it all as 60,000 fans were transfixed with what was occurring in front of their very eyes. Two Celtic goals within THIRTY-FIVE SECONDS, a quickfire reply from the Ibrox side, a red card for a visitor, [...]

The Hoops are unbeaten in the previous three all-Glasgow duels this season [...]

articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS moved to defuse a potential powderkeg situation in tomorrow’s derby after being surprised at the reaction to last weekend’s “have fun” quote. articles.description: Daizen Maeda has not started a game since scoring in the first minute at Ibrox five weeks ago.  His returned to action for the last 20 minutes against Hearts last week is surely not enough to see hi through 90 minutes tomorrow. Ahead of that Ibrox game I suggested Callum McGregor’s natural fitness would be [...]
